actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that appropriations made by the United States shall not exceed its revenues, except in time of war or threat of war as determined by the Congress; and to provide for the systematic paying back of the national debt.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits total fiscal year appropriations from exceeding estimated revenues. Authorizes the Congress to suspend this prohibition in time of war or national emergency. Prohibits any increase in the national debt as it exists on the ratification date. Establishes a schedule for its repayment.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that appropriations made by the United States shall not exceed its revenues, except in time of war or threat of war as determined by the Congress; and to provide for the systematic paying back of the national debt.
